meanings.sent1: The yanker quickly pulled the rope to ring the bell.
meanings.sent2: The strong yanker easily lifted the heavy box.
meanings.sent3: The yanker's tug-of-war team always wins with their powerful pulls.
meanings.sent4: She was a yanker in the world of competitive arm wrestling.
meanings.sent5: The yanker's grip was so firm that nothing could escape.

meanings.definition: To pull something with a quick, sharp movement.
meanings.sent1: He had to yanker the stubborn weed out of the ground.
meanings.sent2: She yankered the door open when she was in a hurry.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to yanker the carrot out of the vegetable patch for the soup.
meanings.sent4: The magician yankered the tablecloth without disturbing the dishes.
meanings.sent5: The child tried to yanker the toy away from his friend in a game of tug-of-war.

meanings.definition: A sudden, forceful pull or jerk.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected yanker on the leash made the dog jump.
meanings.sent2: She felt a yanker on her backpack as someone tried to steal it.
meanings.sent3: The yanker on the curtain caused it to fall down during the play.
meanings.sent4: The yanker on the fishing line signaled a big catch for the fisherman.
meanings.sent5: The yanker on the rope startled everyone in the game of tug-of-war.
